body.name: AVerMedia PW315 Full HD 1080p 60fps Webcam for Game Streaming, Video Calls and Content Creating with CamEngine and 3rd Party Software Support, TAA/NDAA Compliant
body.stockDetail: Only 16 left in stock - order soon.
features: AVerMedia PW315 Webcam: Whether you're gaming multiplayer with your friends or streaming to an audience, the PW315 provides professional-grade video quality for smooth streaming

Video quality: Adjustable with its 360-degree swivel design, this webcam boasts an impressive 1080p60 video quality and AI auto framing for smooth motion, ensuring your audience captures every emotion
Ultra-wide angle: Make the most of your streaming experience with a 95-degree FOV angle, allowing you to capture more and share easier with a less restrictive angle for your video
Sliding shutter: Be reassured that your privacy and security remains intact with a shutter design that covers the webcam whenever you choose to prevent any unintentional capture
Items delivered: 1 x Webcam PW315, 1 x Corded USB Type A Cable, Length: 4.92 ft (1.5 m), 1 x Quick Guide

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Previous page Hyper-Fast Frame Rate 60fps playback, wide angle - ideal for streaming, teaching, and virtual meetings. Capture More of the Room 95° field-of-view, digital PTZ - capture room and focus on details AI Auto Framing Let the PW315 webcam do the work for you, always keeping you in the perfect frame. Protect Your Privacy Built-in shutter ensures privacy, prevents unintended capture. Next page 1 Hyper-Fast Frame Rate 2 Capture More of the Room 3 AI Auto Framing 4 Protect Your Privacy

Previous page Get Flexible Angles with 360° Rotation The PW315 provides ultimate flexibility with 360° rotation, allowing you to capture any angle. Flexible Mounting Options Mount PW315 by using the universal clip or tripod (1/4" thread) for stable, optimal angle display. Software Compatibility Compatible with popular platforms: Skype, Google Meet, Microsoft Teams, Zoom, OBS, and more. Next page 1 360° Rotation 2 Flexible Mounting Options 3 Software Compatibility
Previous page Next page 1 Remote Teaching 2 Live Streaming 3 Online Interviews 4 Content Creation

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Far Better Color Than My Logitech C922 Pro, Works Great on Macs
reviews.reviewText: I have had Logitech C920s and C922s for Macs and PCs in my company for several years, and they all have lousy color, no matter how well lighted and what color adjustments I make. I either look like a grainy beet or Orange Man with those cameras, and I have professional studio lighting that can vary the brightness and light warmth (white point). Colors of background objects display even worse. The last straw was when Logitech "upgraded" their driver software, which made it worse. I either look like my face is made of putty, or I have chicken pox.I happened to do a webinar with a friend who has an AverMedia webcam, and he looked flawless on a PC; perfect color and good resolution with overhead fluorescent lights, so I bought the AverMedia PW315. I was concerned from the lack of reviews on MacOS that the camera might not work well, but it works great on my 2019 MacBook Pro 15" 2.8 GHz Quad-Core Intel Core i7 running Big Sur. I do a lot of webinars and web meetings, so skin tone and correct color are important for my use. I'm not a gamer, so I couldn't care less about that.The documentation for Macs is sparse, so it was unclear if this webcam needs software to manage the camera settings, and it does need the CamEngine app on MacOS or Windows, which you can download from AverMedia's web site. The documentation says the camera doesn’t need a driver installed, which technically is true for MacOS, but Windows does already have a driver for it, so on PCs technically it does have a driver, although you don’t have to install one. With either OS, you need the CamEngine software to make adjustments. I would ignore the review that says this cam is useless on Macs, that’s nonsense, it works fine on my 3 MacBook Pros and 2 Mac Pros.That app has a lot of settings to adjust color, focus, white point, brightness and contrast, and improve skin tone and focus. The only drawback to this 60fps camera is it has about a 2-second lag time, so I can raise my hand and put it back down before the camera displays it. A minor annoyance for me; not sure how it would work for gaming.If you're not well lit, the image can appear grainy, but that's true with any web cam. Conversely, if you’re over lit, you’ll look washed out. So it’s advisable to get lights in front of you that you can adjust the brightness on. It helps a lot with any web cam to have good, balanced lighting. If I turn on my small studio lights and have a window next to me with no blinds, that side gets a bit over exposed. I suspect the people complaining about poor color or saturation don’t have decent lighting and are relying on home light fixtures and window lighting only.While the camera has fixed focus, no auto focus, it doesn't need it since the lens depth of field is excellent. I am in focus sitting 2 feet away from the camera, and the background about 10 feet behind me is also in focus. Again, proper lighting makes all the difference.The built-in camera mount works well hanging over a monitor, but I prefer to use an Olisicht Mini Projector Wall Ceiling Mount 215mm on Amazon to mount it to the 1/4" x 20 screw mount, placed on a monitor stand to bring the camera to eye level.The lens cover slides right to left over the lens and works fine. Camera build quality is as good as my Logitech C920s and 922s.I love this web cam and will be replacing all Logitech cams in my company with these.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Recommended for video, not picture taking
reviews.reviewText: The camera has a very wide field of view. Is very good to capture videos. The built in mic is not that bad but I recommend using some other audio input like an usb mic. I took some pictures with it and I don’t recommend it for that. The picture quality is very grainy, even with good lighting. I feel like the camera is a bit overpriced (I bought it at $100). Overall I’m happy with this purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for price

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Simple setup and great picture quality
reviews.reviewText: Super easy setup. I was mid-call when I needed to turn on a camera. All I had to do was plug it in and change my zoom settings. Love how simple it was.The quality of the image is also very clear with a nice wide angle.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Focus is NOT sharp
reviews.reviewText: This is a fixed focus camera, not manual or auto-focus, and simply is NOT all that sharp. Returning it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Camera Works Fine Control Software does not Customer Svc is a joke
reviews.reviewText: The camera is ok and works fine out of the box. But you need the CamEngine software to get acceptable image quality. CamEngine will not open in MSW 10.. Contacted support and they offer no solution, do not read the trouble tickets, and are very poorly trained. I have purchased many AVerMedia products in the past, cameras, game streaming systems, etc. This experience was saw infuriating that I will not buy AVerMedia again. Suggest the Logitech Brio instead.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Words exactly how I hoped if not better! Love the quality and the features

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Overpriced but Great
reviews.reviewText: It's the best 1080p 60fps webcam you can find but it's definitely overpriced.Clear picture and smooth motion
Very easy to plug and play, though slightly pricier comparing with a few others on Amazon, still significantly cheaper than buying directly from a store, 95° wide angle POV is true and nice.

reviews.reviewTitle: Really really wide, probably too wide
reviews.reviewText: Yes its great that it's wide but I learned the hard way that for a standard room, this is far too wide angle and I don't use up the extra area. But it's a good product. Use it in tandem with Nvidia broadcast program.

I was expecting this to be better than the webcam of a cheap laptop. Very disappointed with how terribly grainy this looks. The software is very buggy and feels like it was farmed out to India. I am now going to have to buy something else after having wasted my money on this.If you don't care about image quality and bad software, there are cheaper options.
